headline: American Shepherd's Pie
description: Ground beef and onions seasoned with thyme and made creamy with vegetable soup are smothered in mashed potatoes, topped with Colby cheese and baked for a hot, hearty dinner.
name: American Shepherd's Pie

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and lightly grease a 2 quart baking dish.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, stir and cook ground beef, onion and celery until juices run clear. Drain. Pour mixture into baking dish with vegetable soup and thyme; stir well. Spread mashed potatoes on top.
Bake 20 minutes. Sprinkle shredded cheese on top and bake 5 minutes more, or until cheese has melted.

review.reviewBody: So many recipes on this site add something to the browning of the ground beef . . . which when draining you are throwing away flavor! Brown the beef by itself, drain and then add your other ingredients. Otherwise this recipe is right on !

Cooked 4 large potatoes, mashed them, added 2TBS butter, tablespoon of horseradish, dash of Worchester , 2 tsp garlic salt, 2 tbps sour cream and some half & half. Great

A fam favorite! Inatead of can soup after the meat is browned I add in 2 cups of cold water and 2 packets of chicken gravy...sharp cheddar cheese on top. YUM!!

I cooked 4 lg russet potatoes for 20 minutes in the Instant Pot, did a quick release and set them aside to cool a bit.
I washed the inner pot and set the IP to saute, cooking the extra lean ground beef, celery and onions as directed. After draining the mixture I added a can of condensed vegetable soup but mine has no corn so I also added about 200g canned corn. I replaced the IP lid just to keep the contents warm then peeled the potatoes and put them into the kitchenaid mixer. I mixed at 1 for about 45 seconds.
Some thinly sliced old cheddar was placed on top of the potatoes after they went onto the meat mixture I had placed into an 8" square pyrex pan.
Twenty minutes later and voila! 
Salt and pepper were added by individuals as was butter.
Very easy, tasty and quick.
Loved it! Even my 8 year old granddaughter said it was her new favorite dish.
2nd time I made it, cooking for one, halved the recipe. Added portobello mushrooms. Delish. Next time , I think I will spice it up a bit with some red chilies.
This was tasty. This is the second time I've made this, and this time I changed a few things. I added corn and bacon on top. My children requested bacon.

Delicious! Great way to use left over roast beef. Add any veggies you like...which I had leftover broccoli, carrots & onions. Broccoli not our favorite, but it was still quite tasty. Used instant mashed potatoes to make a quicker dish and it was fine. Husband has eaten the dish twice as for lunch. Will make again when I have leftover roast beef.
I make a double batch so my daughter can take some home and we can both enjoy the leftovers. Rib sticking goodness!

I just drained the meat & vege's. I like the addition of creamy Cream of Mushroom soup. Used 1/2-N-1/2 for potatoes. Plain cheddar cheese, as that's what I had. Excellent, quick dish. We loved it.

I made this recipe tonight and honestly the recipe as it is, is very bland. I added some beef broth, 3/4 can of corn, some frozen peas, hamburger seasoning, ketchup, salt and pepper. Made like that my boyfriend and I liked it

We’ve made this for years in my family. 2 cans of vegetable soup, and try velveeta inside. The layers are like this: soup and burger mix on bottom, green beans (or veggies of choice) next, velveeta cheese on top of the veggies, the mashed potatoes on top. Yummy with a nice cheesy sauce!
No I made it exactly to the recipe. It was delicious!!

Satisfying and filling on a cool winter's day!

I have been searching for YEARS for this recipe since losing my nearly identical one when I lost my cookbook in a fire. I was SO happy and excited to find it and one other nearly identical recipe from my book! This will finally, once again, become a regular dinner go to in my house.
Entire family loves it.
Easy. Tastes good.
I used cream of mushroom soup and added corn. It turned out very tasty. I will make it again!
Very easy to make. My family loved it!

For those who don't know what Colby Longhorn is, you must not live in the midwest :) Longhorn is a style of American Colby cheese defined by its round, long, orange cylindrical shape. When cut for packaging it resembles a moon or shalf moon. It is made from cow's milk rather than sheep's or goat's milk. The flavour can be anything from mild to sharp but it is usually a Colby or Jack cheese.

generally simple and good shepherds pie. I had to update mine with some good old herbs and spices but nothing too fancy. turned out good. I also added peas because I feel they belong in a shepherds pie
Awesome, so good and my three children gobbled it up. This will be our regular.

I didn't use any thyme, the kids don't like onions so those are out, I don't eat celery so that had to go. I did throw in a can of peas, corn, and green beans. For the cheese I used Mexican blend shredded, and a little mozzarella. Everyone in the house loved it. A wonderfully flexible recipe!
It's was so good, I put cream of soup instead, came out delicious!!
Super good!!!

I tried this recipe with a few alterations. I didn't have tomatoe soup,so I used fajita sauce in my meat and veggie mixture. Also I added a can of stewed tomatoes and this dish came out supurb and so full of flavor!
This is a great base recipe, easily tweaked to accommodate picky eaters by changing the soup or which vegetables you use. It always goes fast.
It was GREAT!! I used Steak chopped up and the kids LOVE IT!!

Very easy version of Shepherd's Pie, which is just what I was looking for. I followed the recipe as written, except that I also added some leftover corn and green beans I had in the fridge. It's a good 'cleaning out the fridge' meal!
this is one of the best family meals we have had in a while. Can't go wrong with hamburger and mashed potatoes. Mix that with baking and cheese and you have a winner.

Great tasting and easy recipe!!! I substituted the vegetable soup with cream of mushroom like everyone else suggests, and instead of celery I added corn. I will be making this again. Thanks for sharing

I made this last night & it was absolutely delicious! Although, I did make it completely different, lol. After browning the hamburger with the onion & celery I added: white beans, creamed corn, stewed tomatos, onion soup mix, green chilis & cream of mushroom soup. I did not use thyme or vegetable soup. I made my own mashed potatos to put on top and mixed some cheese into the potatos instead of topping it with cheese at the end. You really can throw anything you want in there. My boyfriend & I both agreed this was one of the best things I have made in awhile. Don't be afraid to experiment! Oh yeah and salt & pepper to taste (always).

My kids and hubby liked it. I did change a few things. I seasoned the meat to my families liking which included garlic, salt, pepper and a bit of worchestire sauce. I added green peppers with the meat and onions and celery. I used cream of mushroom instead and added a can of corn (drained) everyone liked a great quick meal with some yummy rolls or corn bread make a hearty warm meal for cold rainy Seattle days!

My family loved this! I used a hearty, thickened vegetable broth instead of soup and added the real vegetables in between. Even when we had it as leftovers, the kids raved.

Quick, easy, delicious! Good comfort food for any busy weeknight

This recipe was good with modifications (thank you, Sworden!). I really liked it, and my boyfriend thought it was good, but not great. I added a clove of garlic to the hamburger, celery, and onions and cooked that on the stove. I used vegetable soup. I also added about half a can of green beans, half a can of corn, and -- this is SO important -- 3 tablespoons of worchestire sauce. Without the worchestire, this would be super bland. I also added the 4-cheese Idahoan brand potatoes on top, which tasted great! I only used one package, and it was barely enough to cover the top. If you want a thick layer of taters, you should use 1 1/2 to two packages of potatoes. Served this with cornbread, which was a great flavor combo. I also used very lean ground beef to cut fat and so I didn't even have to strain the beef after cooking. Will make this again.

I love shepard's pie, and this one is
definately a winner!
Great dish, family loved it.

Using suggestions from others: extra seasonings, black pepper, paprika, garlic, and substituting cream of mushroom soup, this was perfect for my picky husband, he doesn't like too many veggies so I added small cans of corn and green beans to meat mixture, it was great! I will make this again soon!
Delicious,quick,& easy! Definitely a family favorite and goes quick! Will make again for sure.

I am only giving this 3 stars because with a few changes this recipe is so much better. Cook the beef and onion, leave out the celery. Use any cream of soup, I think it is best with cream of mushroom. Mix soup with Cooked beef and onion. Use this as the bottom layer. Add steamed or canned corn as 2nd layer. Mashed potatoes are the third layer. The use American cheese slices to cover top. My late father made this when mom was away. "snow on the mountain"

This was pretty good as is, but if I make it again I will change it up a bit. I will use more veggies and my husband wanted more meat. Other than that it was pretty good.

it was just ok if you ask me the next time i make it ill leave out the vegetable soup and replce it with beef stock and fresh vegetables(peas,corn,carrots)the best part was the crunch from the chopped onion and celery.

This recipe is awesome! I read that many people changed the soup from vegetable to mushroom, but I decided to stick with the recipe. The soup added great flavor to the beef mixture. I added corn, green beans, 3 T of Worcestershire sauce (brings out the flavor), 1 clove of garlic when cooking meat. Instead of ground beef, I used ground turkey. I also used Idahoan Four Cheese potatoes and omitted the thyme, since I'm not a big fan of thyme. It was amazing! Definitely will be making this again! Thank you so much for this recipe!
Update....I tried it with cream of mushroom soup, and it still tastes wonderful. Definitely add the Worcestershire; without it, it's bland.
I loved it...my whole family loved it...next time I have to make a larger pan...i made it with the cream of mushroom soup as someone suggested and it turned out fantastic...

This is one of comfort foods. The rest of the family seems to really like this too. I add lots of garlic, I usually use cream of mushroom and some times I add veggies canned or frozen. Yum yum

There were a lot of veggies in the meat mixture. I also substituted a can of vegetarian vegetable soup for regular veggie soup. Used 4 cps. prepared instant mashed potatoes. Per my husband's suggestion, put about a 1/2 tsp. of chicken base (paste) & 1/4 cp. of water to add flavor since I had used 1 1/2 lbs. of ground turkey. Turned out great, and will more than likely be even better as leftovers.

Good, hearty Americana.

I absolutely agree with many other comments. This is a good base recipe and then add other ingredients to your liking. I added Worcestershire to the meat along with a few other spices (pepper, garlic powder). I put some thawed frozen peas and carrots on the meat before adding the potatoes. I used the steam and mash potatoes from the freezer section (Ore Ida brand) and they worked great. Really easy for a weekday night. I'm a huge mashed potato snob and I thought those were just fine. Usually canned soup gives dishes a canned, cheap taste but this is a very good basic recipe. I add a clove of garlic and double the onion.
This is an excellent dish when you get sick of tacos and hamburgers. I made it back in January and my family scarfed it down. I used flour in mine though.
Super easy,& Super good!! Added lots of garlic, don't add too much thyme, and used med. sharp shredded cheddar.

Love this recipe, great for using up leftover mashed potatoes. I used the mushroom soup and added leftover carrots, green peppers, 2 cups of cheese and fresh garlic. I didn't use the thyme thought it would clash. Definitely a keeper.

Instead of celery, I used a can of corn. I also increased the amount of thyme. This is a good basic recipe and w/ the changes, I'd give it 5 stars.

I changed the recipe based on other recommendations, plus because I try to make it healthy, (canned soups are high in sodium)..this is what I changed: I used 2 lbs beef and added 1 clove garlic, and increased onions to 2/3 cup.. I added 1 1/2 tsp. worchestershire , and 1/2 tsp peri peri to meat. I don't use canned soup, so I used "Imagine" organic creamy tomato & basil soup..(about 2 cups for 2 lbs. beef)... I also added some frozen peas to beef mixture I added the soup to the meat / veg mixture in the frying pan and mixed together. We like lots of potatoes, so I used 6 rather huge ones... I also omitted the cheese, as we are lactose interolerant. Yummy!!!!
